div1.p: No. 41
U.S. Consulate Monrovia Dec. 23/86
Mr S. S. Sevier,
To the Secty of State,
Subject
Secretarys circular received.
Sir: I have the honor to inform you that your circular of Nov. 18/86 conveying the painful intelligence of the death of Ex. President Gen. Chester A Arthur was received.
According to special order I shall display
display the usual symbols of mourning for the period of thirty days.

Please find inclosed a copy of a despatch from the Department of State of Liberia expressing their sympathy which is felt in the loss of so distinguished patriotic man as Ex. President Gen. Chester A. Arthur.
I am Sir your obedient servant
Samuel S. Sevier Acting Consul Gen.
Inclosures
1. copy of Despatch from the Secty of State of Liberia.
Department of State, Monrovia Dec. 24, 1886
S. S. Sevier Esq Acting U.S. Consul Gen. Monrovia
Sir, Your letter of th 22nd inst. has been received in which you communicated the sad intelligence of the death of the late Ex. President of the United States0 General C. A. Arthur.
Please accept assurances of my sympathy, and of the sympathy of my Government with that of the United States in the loss it has sustained
in the death of so illustrious and honored a citizen.
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient Servant
E. J. Barclay Secty of State.
